subtasks: Traveling to the field with the sprayer
Positioning the sprayer near the coffee plants
Pouring 2in1 into the sprayer tank
Connecting the nozzle to the sprayer
Adjusting the sprayer settings for application
Wearing personal protective equipment (PPE)
Ensuring even coverage of 2in1 on the plants
Observing the wind direction and speed to prevent drift
Keeping an eye on the sprayer's flow rate
Disconnecting the nozzle from the sprayer
Detaching the sprayer hose
Emptying any remaining 2in1 from the sprayer
Washing the sprayer according to manufacturer instructions
Transporting the empty sprayer back to the storage
Storing the sprayer in the appropriate location
Putting on clean clothes and removing PPE
Noting the date and amount of 2in1 applied
Checking if adjacent fields need similar treatment

tasks.task: Checking plants for any visible signs of disease
subtasks: Observing the leaves and stems for fungal spots or wilting
Inspecting the canopy for uneven infection
Reporting any findings to the farm manager
Checking the sprayer's fluid levels
Inspecting nozzles for clogs or wear
Tightening loose connections on the sprayer

tasks.task: Preparing for the next day's work
subtasks: Gathering necessary supplies for the next day's crop treatment
Checking weather forecast for适宜的条件 to apply chemicals
Ensuring all required PPE is accounted for
